website_summaries.verdict: The Toshiba DMF82XKU 8-inch Digital Media Frame is a decent photo-viewing choice for Picasa, Facebook, and Flickr fans, but the overall package could use some polish and probably a firmware update.
pros: good support for files, memory cards
cons: wide screen not ideal for photos

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent frame. With Framechannel, all I have to do is email photos to my account and they show up on my frame. Very easy to use and works great. It also is an excellent for the grandparents.
customer_reviews.author: Wai Hong Lee

customer_reviews.title: Toshiba Digital Frame A Look Back in Time
customer_reviews.text: This is a very cool picture frame. I bought it for my parents to view pictures of family here and abroad. It was easy to setup and I was able to setup the online file sharing so family can post pictures from different cities. It has weather reports and news and the different display styles make it cool and practical. It would have been nice to have it battery operated so that it could be placed anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: A. Yamini

customer_reviews.title: Framechannel No More
customer_reviews.text: I took this frame, after reading on the features, wifi and most importantly framechannel integration. Just few months after, framechannel services were shut down. Toshiba has also not updated the hardware (or I am not able to find update) to include any other services. Now it can only talk to picassa or the SD card. Vikas.
customer_reviews.author: Vikas Gupta

customer_reviews.title: NICE FRAME
customer_reviews.text: Brought this picture frame for my wife for Christmas and she loves it...Its been a couple of months now and she still can't keep her hands off it. GREAT picture quality and appearance.
customer_reviews.author: Delta1

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, but perhaps a bit overpriced at $124.
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this wireless digital picture frame for 3 days. Setup was easy. So far I have only run it using framechannel to display my pictures, the weather, and the calendar. Nothing else thus far although there do seem to be many choices - I figure the weather and calendar are the only things I really want around all the time (because they don't require follow up). Image is sharp and bright. I bought mine for $55 from woot. I am thrilled with it for that price. Probably would be thrilled with it up to about $100. At current list, I think it is a bit overpriced, but I have not shopped this category much.
customer_reviews.author: ProfArk3

customer_reviews.title: Death of Framechannel renders wi-fi useless!!
customer_reviews.text: The death of the framechannel makes the wi-fi option useless. Framechannel was the only way to get rich multimedia options and pictures on the frame through wifi. The wifi has no other functionality now that framechannel shut it's doors. You're better off buying a cheaper equivalent without the wifi cause that's what your left with. Even when the frame channel was up and running, I had connectivity issues with it. Other than that, it's a great looking frame!
customer_reviews.author: PKCH

customer_reviews.title: Do not purchase a Toshiba Digital Photo Frame
customer_reviews.text: These products are no longer supported by Toshiba. Since the manual is not included in the box, one can be found at the Retrevo web site, but I was unable to find mention of it on the various Toshiba sites. The referenced "toshibaframe.com" site in the documents is a web site for the Toshiba touchpad. In addition, the WiFi services are virtually useless -- One service, Framechannel is no longer available.
customer_reviews.author: John Moore

customer_reviews.title: Can't delete...Just a piece of Junk
customer_reviews.text: OK it is simple until you have an issue. Won't show some of the JPG files (saying not supported) then shows others. I double checked the files....all are the same format. Go to mode and it shows which are working and which are not. But, it doesn't tell you the name of the file so maybe you can delete them....Oh there is no delete button. I own a Kodak and Hp frames...go for them and stay away from this one.
customer_reviews.author: M. N. Reiman

customer_reviews.title: FrameChannel is dead.
customer_reviews.text: FrameChannel is dead as of today and Picasa support only shows the last 25 or so pictures uploaded. Skip it.
customer_reviews.author: J. Crosby

customer_reviews.title: Best gift ever!
customer_reviews.text: My darling daughter purchased this for me for my Birthday. It was easy to set up and the pix are fantastic. I love the feature of the email, as my son and his family are in Okinawa in the Marines and now they can send pix straight to my frame. What a great surprise when I see new pix of my grandkids!Every grandparent should have one or two or ... Great buy in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: N0N4M3

customer_reviews.title: Very cool once you get it working.  Not simple to configure.
customer_reviews.text: The 'buttons' on the right (if you call them that) are a bit difficult to use and definitely take some getting used to. Because of that, it takes much longer to configure things like wireless settings, etc than it should. If the controls were improved, then this would be a great product. Still pretty decent.
customer_reviews.author: Chad P

product_meta.title: Toshiba DMF82XKU 8-Inch Wireless Digital Media Frame (Black)
product_meta.description:
8-Inch Digital Media Frame

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
The Toshiba DMF82XKU Digital Media Frame is far from your average photo frame. Sure it displays all your favorite memories directly from your memory card or its internal 1GB memory, but Toshiba has taken frames one step further. Thanks to built in Wi-Fi and Framechannel, which offers over 1,000 channels of premium content, the new Toshiba Digital Media Frames can link to your favorite online photo sharing services directly through your wireless router. This means that you can view not only your favorite Picasa, Flickr or Webshots photo albums but also your Facebook photos, and your selected friends Facebook photos – all the albums you select, will display directly on your frame without having to turn on your PC! Best of all, your friends can send you photos from anywhere that can automatically be displayed on your frame. Imagine being on vacation and sending mom your photos, without her ever turning on her PC.

The Toshiba Digital Media Frames are so versatile that in addition to becoming your family’s favorite photo album, you can set it up to keep you updated with the latest weather reports, news, stocks and sports, even if you happen to be a fan of British Football! You simply select the content that you want to display, when and how often you want to see it and Framechannel will send it to your frame!

Any Digital Photo Frame can display your pictures. Toshiba’s Digital Media Frames keep you connected with your world.

What's in the Box:


 * DMF82XKU - Digital Media Frame
 * Remote Control
 * AC Adapter (100-240V)
 * AC Power Cord
 * Set-up Guide
feature_bullets: 8-inch (measured diagonally) 16:9 Widescreeen with 800 x 480 Resolution and 500:1 Contrast Ratio
Wi-Fi (802.11b/g) Capable with WPS Security and FrameChannel Support for easy online sharing of photos
JPEG, TIFF, and BMP Compatibility provide a multitude of options for your favorite photos
MPEG 1/2/4 Video for viewing video clips without a computer
MP3/WMA Playback3 with Built-in Stereo Speakers allow you to accentuate slideshows with audio

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.0 out of 5 stars20 ratings3.0 out of 5 stars
